H0.text: who appoints the chief election commissioner of india. Prime Minister of India

H1.text: who appoints the chief election commissioner of india. Leader of the Opposition

H2.text: who appoints the chief election commissioner of india. Parliament

H3.text: who appoints the chief election commissioner of india. the president

A4.text: An election commissioner is appointed by the president of India on the recommendation of a three-member selection committee headed by the prime minister and consisting of the leader of the opposition and a Union Cabinet minister.

A5.text: The CEC can be removed from the office through the process of impeachment, requiring a twoâ€‘thirds majority of the Lok Sabha and the Rajya Sabha to be present and voting for the same.
